answers.question: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds

answers.answer: Human Passport is the leading web3 unique human verification solution. We offer an API, smart contracts, and other tools that enable projects to protect themselves from Sybils and other bad actors. We also have comprehensive analysis and insights into which wallets are unique humans, and which are likely Sybils or bots. This means, we can help ensure trusted experiences in digital communities where knowing you are interacting with a real human is important, but you don't need to know who that real human is (ie, we are a non-doxxing solution).
answers.question: Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?

answers.answer:
Launching applications in the web3 space is increasingly easy. What is hard is building an organic community, with real users while ensuring incentives are allocated fairly. Passport helps with each of these steps. We enable communities to protect their projects from Sybil and bots so that real humans can flourish in those ecosystems. Often, the success of these programs are built around unique human participation, such as governance, rewards, and other community programs. By integrating with Passport, developers and ecosystems can better understand who the unique humans are in their network and reward them appropriately. 
Story’s partnership with Human Passport, now part of human.tech, exemplifies the ideal Testnet-to-Mainnet integration strategy. By combining onchain transaction analysis using Passports machine learning models and sybil clustering with offchain (Stamp-based) unique human verification, Story successfully secured its token launch and established a sustainable, trust-based ecosystem.
answers.question: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.

answers.answer: Passport is integrated with over 120 dApps and partners in the Ethereum community, has over 2.2m wallets with a Passport score above 0 (ie, users have come to earn and prove at least a single Stamp), and Passport's primary repository has ~1100 stars. We serve roughly 675k API requests a day, and we have had numerous integrators get set up with Sybil defense in just a morning and a few lines of code.
answers.question: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.

answers.answer:
We are heavily prioritizing building and releasing a new Human Passport offering called Passport Embeds, which will enable partners to embed Passport’s unique humanity scoring solution directly into their site so users can verify themselves in-flow. 


We are also exploring how we can enable users to link Stamps from multiple wallets into a single wallet, which will better serve those users who have different wallets for different use cases. 


And as always, we are exploring making Passport more secure. By implementing human.tech’s AVS, Human Network, in the back end of the Stamps-based product, Passport will become more decentralized and quantum secure.
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Human Passport (formerly Gitcoin Passport)
project.description:
Human Passport is the premier web3 native offering that enables ecosystems to protect, understand and organically grow what matters most – their communities. Passport is at the confluence of a best in class identity solution, backed by the most relevant and comprehensive data analysis toolset that also offers communities the ability to ascribe reputation. Born from Gitcoin’s Grants program and the need for anti-Sybil protection, Passport has now evolved to an independent organization focused on enabling real humans to prove their unique humanity through proofs and reputation.

Passport's developer tools enable partners to protect their program from Sybils and other bad actors with just a few lines of code. With over 75 integrators using the onchain smart contracts and offchain APIs, Passport aims to make the challenging Sybil problem into an easy solution.
